From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia


2024 film by Sagar Ambre and Pushkar Ojha


YodhaTheatrical release posterDirected bySagar AmbrePushkar OjhaWritten bySagar AmbreProduced byHiroo Yash JoharKaran JoharApoorva MehtaShashank KhaitanStarringSidharth MalhotraRaashii KhannaDisha PataniCinematographyJishnu BhattacharjeeEdited byShivkumar V. PanickerMusic bySongs:Tanishk BagchiVishal MishraB PraakAditya DevJohn Stewart EduriScore:John Stewart EduriProductioncompaniesAmazon MGM Studios[1]Dharma ProductionsMentor Disciple EntertainmentDistributed byAA FilmsRelease date
15 March 2024 (2024-03-15)
Running time130 minutes[2]CountryIndiaLanguageHindiBudget₹55 crore[3]Box office₹32.45 crore[4]
Yodha (transl. Warrior) is a 2024 Indian Hindi-language action thriller film written and directed by Sagar Ambre and Pushkar Ojha, and produced by Hiroo Yash Johar, Karan Johar and Apoorva Mehta under the banner of Dharma Productions,[5] The film stars Sidharth Malhotra, Raashii Khanna and Disha Patani.[6][7]
Yodha was theatrically released on 15 March 2024.[8] It underperformed at the box office.[9]


Cast
Sidharth Malhotra as Arun Katyal, an army soldier and a member of the Yodha Task Force
Raashii Khanna as Priyamvada "Priya" Katyal, Arun’s wife
Disha Patani as Laila Khalid, a flight attendant
Ronit Roy as Major Surender Katyal, Arun's father and the founder of the Yodha Task Force
Tanuj Virwani as Sameer Khan
Sunny Hinduja as Jalal
Kritika Bhardwaj as Tanya Sharma
S. M. Zaheer as Anuj Nair
Chittranjan Tripathy as S N Dhingra
Farida Patel Venkat as Mrs. Katyal, Arun's mother
Mikhail Yawalkar as Ahmed Khalid
Sanjay Gurbaxani as Indian Head of State
Production
Principal photography began on 27 November 2021.[10][11] On 18 December 2021, Raashii Khanna and Disha Patani were announced as the leading actresses.[12][13] In December 2021, Patani wrapped up her portion of the shoot and wrote a rap song for Badshah.[14][15] In March 2022, Raashii Khanna wrapped up her portions.[16] Later, Tanuj Virwani was cast in a prominent role.[17]

Soundtrack
YodhaSoundtrack album by Tanishk Bagchi,  Vishal Mishra, B Praak, Aditya Dev and John Stewart EduriReleased15 March 2024GenreFeature film soundtrackLength20:49LanguageHindiLabelT-SeriesOfficial audioYodha (Full Album) on YouTube

The music of the film is composed by Tanishk Bagchi, Vishal Mishra, B Praak, Aditya Dev and John Stewart Eduri while lyrics are written by Manoj Muntashir, Jaani, Kunaal Vermaa, Vishal Mishra and Kaushal Kishore.[18] The first single titled "Zindagi Tere Naam" was released on 24 February 2024.[19] The second single titled "Tere Sang Ishq Hua" was released on 7 March 2024.[20]

Track listingNo.TitleLyricsMusicSinger(s)Length1."Zindagi Tere Naam"Kaushal Kishore, Vishal MishraVishal MishraVishal Mishra3:282."Qismat Badal Di"JaaniB Praak, Aditya DevAmmy Virk, B Praak5:093."Tere Sang Ishq Hua"Kunaal VermaaTanishk BagchiArijit Singh, Neeti Mohan3:384."Tiranga"Manoj MuntashirTanishk BagchiB Praak4:225."Zindagi Tere Naam" (Soul Version)Kaushal Kishore, Vishal MishraVishal MishraVishal Mishra3:006."Yodha Theme"-John Stewart Eduri-1:12Total length:20:49
Release
Theatrical
The film was scheduled to be released on 7 July 2023 but was delayed.[21] The film was then postponed to 8 December 2023 and finally released on 15 March 2024.[8]

Reception
On the review aggregator website Rotten Tomatoes, 58% of 12 critics' reviews are positive, with an average rating of 4.8/10.[22]
Bollywood Hungama critic gave 3 out of 5 stars and wrote "Yodha is not the usual hijack film and features a fine performance; however, it is quite technical and confusing."[23]
NDTV's Saibal Chatterjee rated the film 1.5/5 and wrote "No matter how lenient you might want to be and how much of a Sidharth Malhotra fan you are, this pulpy action movie is a bumpy ride that lurches from one misstep to another."[24]
Sukanya Verma of Rediff.com gave 2.5/5 stars and observed "A light-footed Sidharth single-handedly going at the baddies is a slick sight. Armed in swag, sunglasses and slow motion, the man is more than fit for the job. And it’s on his charm and rugged shoulders that Yodha shamelessly rests".[25]
Anupama Chopra, in her review for Film Companion said that "Yodha is a cheesy, chest-thumping, low-on-logic thriller that rides brazenly to a crowd-pleasing finale, mostly on the shoulders of a solid Sidharth Malhotra."[26]
Rishil Jogani of Pinkvilla rated the film 2.5/5 and opined that "Yodha has redeemable qualities and offers thrills too but the film in totality is a tiresome watch, full of clichés, cheesy dialogues and overused tropes."[27]
